translated: When there is a need for it,
it will be for my benefit.
From the king or from a slanderer,
or from one who is oppressed by thieves;
Or for the sake of being freed from debt,
in times of famine or danger;
For this purpose in the world,
Not all of it will always be useful,

original: tassa taṁ upakappati.🔽Nidhi vā ṭhānā cavati,
analyzed: tassa tam upakappati  nidhi vā ṭhānā cavati
translated: for him.🔽The treasure may move from its place,
Or the nāgas may take it away,
or the spirits may carry it off.
may dig it up without his knowledge;

analyzed: yassa dānena sīlena  sayamena damena ca
translated: For one who by generosity, virtue,🔽restraint, and self-control;
whether a woman or a man.
In a shrine or in the Saṅgha,
in an individual or in guests;
In a mother or a father,
unconquerable, a follower.🔽When you must go, leaving everything,
a treasure that thieves cannot carry off,
the wise one should make merit,
This treasure gives all that is wished for

analyzed: sabbam etena labbhati  su vaṇṇa tā su saratā
translated: all is obtained through this.🔽Beauty, a sweet voice,
a good figure, a good complexion,
the dear happiness of a wheel-turning monarch,
even the rulership of the gods in the heavens,
and the delights of the heavenly worlds,

analyzed: sabbam etena labbhati  mitta sampadam āgamma
translated: all is obtained through this.🔽Having attained the prosperity of friends,
The analytical knowledges and the liberations,
and the perfection of a disciple,
the enlightenment of a paccekabuddha and Buddhahood,
the wise who have made merit.
